title: Stored XSS on https://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/plugins/socialbookmarking/updatebookmark.action
content:
Summary:
Hi :) Adding javascript url causes to stored XSS when creating bookmark.
Steps To Reproduce:
Go to https://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/plugins/socialbookmarking/updatebookmark.action . Write javascript:alert(document.domain) on url input and fill other areas. After create, go https://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/display/tcwiki/<TITLE> and when you click the title on this page, XSS will execute.
<image_0>
Impact
XSS can use to steal cookies or to run arbitrary code on victim's browser.
steps: Enter 'javascript:alert(document.domain)' in the URL input field and fill in other required fields
Create the bookmark and navigate to https://apps.topcoder.com/wiki/display/tcwiki/<TITLE>
Click on the bookmark title to trigger the XSS payload
vuln_description: A stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability exists in the social bookmarking feature of the Topcoder wiki. By injecting a JavaScript URL when creating a bookmark, an attacker can execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the context of the victim's browser when the bookmark is clicked.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward injection of a JavaScript URL into a bookmark, which is a common and well-documented XSS vector. The attack does not require complex interactions or understanding of multiple components, making it relatively easy to discover.

authnz_metadata.reason: The XSS vulnerability involves injecting a JavaScript URL into a bookmark, which is a client-side issue and does not involve authentication or authorization bypass. The methodology described focuses on testing authentication and authorization boundaries by swapping user sessions and resource IDs, which is not applicable here.
